overview.summary: Create an output nrrd that is a subsample of the original.

description.p: Crop preserves dimension. To get valid values in the gui the module must execute. After first execution, the user interface has correct values, and will perform a crop that produces the identical nrrd as was input. The min and max pairs per axis in the user interface are the sample indecies that you wish to crop.

The tuple axis has logical indecies that represent the whole labeled chunk of data along the axis. Look at the example network. It's input has 2 data sets along the tuple axis, gradients (Vector type), and potentials (Scalar type). Using NrrdInfo you can verify this. In the NrrdCrop user interface index 0 corresponds to the gradients Vector data set, and index 1 corresponds to the Scalar set named potentials.
